position.marginalia_text: Pluris valent, non qui plura possu[n]t, sed qui plus.

marginalia.translation: More valuable are not those men who can do more things, but those who can be more.

position.marginalia_text: Libauerunt de sanguine uva[e], filij Aaronis. Vt eccè in splendidissimo Encomio Simonis Onia[e]: / cui nullum Elogium par, in omni humanitate, Romana, Attica, Heroica.

marginalia.translation: The children of Aaron poured out the blood of the grape in libation. And here in this most splendid encomium of Simon, son of Onia, to which no other saying is equal, in any culture, Roman, Greek, or Heroic.

position.marginalia_text: Alij Sui, et alieni: solus Eutrapelus suissimus. Sua Singula assiduè augens, et mirificè multiplicans.

marginalia.translation: Other men are beholden to a friend or stranger, only Eutrapelus is his very own. He constantly increases and wondrously multiplies his singular deeds.

position.marginalia_text: Omnes in vno auxeses, hyperbola[e], metamorphoses, theogonia[e].

marginalia.translation: All amplification, increase, transformation, theogony in one man.

position.marginalia_text: Multi vrbani, non pragmatici: multi pragmatici, non vrbani: Da mihi vrbanu[m] pragmaticum: tam politicu[m],
= Solum combinatorem salium, et stratagematu[m]: ad Optimu[m], qui esse potest, pra[e]sente[m] vsum. Semper tibi pendeat [h]amus Fauoris, et Commoditatis.

marginalia.translation: Many urbane men are not pragmatic, and many pragmatic men are not urbane. Give me an urbane and pragmatic man, as political as he is witty; give me only him who combines wit and stratagems, approaching the best possible practice for the present time.
